intro: Centropogon solisii, commonly known as the sun's flame or sunflower of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a hardy plant in temperate climates. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
